doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
creation: 1815; alteration: 1816; alteration: 1855-1856; alteration: mid 19th century; alteration: 1907; alteration: 1946; alteration: 1991

Old Ivy Inn 1946; once a Distillery --Garallan--Bonnie-Mart--Seymour--Montesano--McFarland Home--Louis T Hanckel Home--Sen Thomas S Martin Home 1907--Frizell Home--Judge Charles Goodyear Home--Haze Home--Jewry (Jurey) Home--Named for William Faulkner, Nobel Prize Winner & University of Virginia Writer in Residence 1957-58--Yankee Gen Devins Headquarters in Civil War--Now Miller Center of Public Affairs, J Wilson Newman Pavilion

1855-56 Brick I-House: Tetrastyle Portico with Pie-Shaped Doric Columns, Suspended Balcony, 3 Bay, Hipped Roof, 5 Course American with Flemish Bond, Penciling, Brick Painted Red, Circular Saw Marks, 4 Panel Doors with Applied Moldings, 6/6, Blinds; Newer mid 19th century Brick I-House: Tetrastyle Portico, Fanlight, Lunette in Tympanum, Cantilevered Balcony, 3 Bay then 5 Bay, Hipped Roof, 5 Course American with Flemish Bond, Penciling, Brick Painted Red, , Circular Saw Marks, Attic Water Tank, Joist extension for roof overhang in attic 4 Panel Doors with Applied Moldings, 6/6, Blinds
George Sidney Ford, Builder 1907--Waddy Wood, Architect 1907--Marshall Wells, Architect 1946--Allan Greenberg, Architect 1991
survey data: National Register of Historic Places--Virginia Landmarks Register--Virginia Road Traces--Architecture in Virginia
Jesse Lewis House Burned--Rebuilt by Jesse Pittman Lewis--I-House to North--I-House to South--South Portico, Wings
